attributes.action: Support and protect the only functioning democracy in the Horn of Africa -Somaliland
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Harold Macmillan, told the House: 
"I should like to say, however, that it is Her Majesty's Government's hope that whatever may be the constitutional future of the Protectorate, the friendship which has been built up between its people and those of the United Kingdom for so many years will continue and indeed flourish." [Official Report, 11 April 1960; Vol. 621, c. 104W.] 

In view of this solemn promise; the Report presented to Parliament by Hon. Tony Worthington (Clydebank and Milngavie-Lab), on 4th February 2004, and the AU Fact Finding Report that confirmed Somaliland independence quest as a special case, we implore you take a leading role in supporting and protecting Somaliland's nascent democracy from collapse either due to continued international indifference, active military attack by Somalia or external terrorism. It is morally imperative and politically expedient to support Somaliland’s democracy as a definite way of averting a perpetual conflict in the Horn of Africa
